doc.field: Includes the election of Cardinal Hayes as associate member of Society; series of letters between A.J.Wall (N-YHS Librarian) and Alfred C. Potter (Harvard College Librarian) with regard to a book purchased by N-YHS from Schulte's Book store, Set of Plans and Forts in America Reduced from Actual Surveys, which had been stolen from Harvard Library; lecture programs. Subjects: Oakes Smith collection, Ignaz Anton Pilat, Governor Henry Hamilton, Washington Bicentennial Commission, Gulian C. Verplanck, Alexander Hamilton, mortgage policies. Correspondents: Cardinal Hayes; Germanic Museum (Harvard); Harvard University; Hamburg-American Line; (map engravers, printers, and publishers) C.S.Hammon & Company; historian Alvin F. Harlow; State Library and Museum (Pennsylvania); New York Life Insurance Co.
Series IV. General Correspondence >> Correspondence 1930-1932. Ham - Haz (2 folders)
